definitions.definition: existing in a material or physical form; not abstract.
definitions.example: concrete objects like stones

definitions.definition: a building material made from a mixture of broken stone or gravel, sand, cement, and water, which can be spread or poured into moulds and forms a stone-like mass on hardening.
definitions.example: slabs of concrete

definitions.definition: the state of something with regard to its appearance, quality, or working order.
definitions.example: the wiring is in good condition

definitions.definition: the circumstances or factors affecting the way in which people live or work, especially with regard to their well-being.
definitions.example: harsh working and living conditions

definitions.definition: a situation that must exist before something else is possible or permitted.
definitions.example: for a member to borrow money, three conditions have to be met

definitions.definition: have a significant influence on or determine (the manner or outcome of something).
definitions.example: national choices are conditioned by the international political economy

definitions.definition: bring (something) into the desired state for use.
definitions.example: a product for conditioning leather

definitions.definition: apply a conditioner to (the hair).
definitions.example: I condition my hair regularly

definitions.definition: set prior requirements on (something) before it can occur or be done.
definitions.example: Congressmen have sought to limit and condition military and economic aid

definitions.definition: the manner in which a person behaves, especially in a particular place or situation.
definitions.example: they were arrested for disorderly conduct

definitions.definition: the manner in which an organization or activity is managed or directed.
definitions.example: the conduct of the elections

definitions.definition: organize and carry out.
definitions.example: in the second trial he conducted his own defence

definitions.definition: lead or guide (someone) to or around a particular place.
definitions.example: he conducted us through his personal gallery of the Civil War

definitions.definition: direct the performance of (a piece of music or an orchestra, choir, etc.).
definitions.example: the concert is to be conducted by Sir Simon Rattle

definitions.definition: behave in a specified way.
definitions.example: he conducted himself with the utmost propriety

definitions.definition: a commercial association for the regulation of an area of activity or the exchange of information.
definitions.example: an international authority or, if that was not possible, a regional operators' conference

definitions.definition: a formal meeting of people with a shared interest, typically one that takes place over several days.
definitions.example: an international conference on the environment

definitions.definition: the feeling or belief that one can have faith in or rely on someone or something.
definitions.example: we had every confidence in the staff

definitions.definition: the telling of private matters or secrets with mutual trust.
definitions.example: someone with whom you may raise your suspicions in confidence

definitions.definition: feeling or showing confidence in oneself or one's abilities or qualities.
definitions.example: she was a confident, outgoing girl

definitions.definition: a confidant.
feeling or showing certainty about something.
definitions.example: this time they're confident of a happy ending

definitions.definition: having strong belief or full assurance; sure: confident of fulfillment. sure of oneself; having no uncertainty about one's own abilities, correctness, successfulness, etc.; self-confident; bold: a confident speaker.
